comment.body: I love the NÃ¤iv. Great view and nice terrace during summer time. Feels very urban. Not a huge, but weekly (I believe?) changing selection of craft beers

Hello /u/RealGrapefruit8930, thank you for posting a question. Have you checked [our wiki](/r/frankfurt/wiki/index)  or the [stickied FAQ thread at the top of our subreddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/frankfurt/comments/otfb7a/visitors_and_newcomers_to_frankfurt_please_post/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=web2x&context=3)?

I'm going to be honest, "craft beer" is mostly not very good in Germany. You will probably not find any kind of IPA that is anything better than "ok." That being said, there are small local German brewers who make some of the best Helles in the entire world right in the Frankfurt area. I recommend you go to Drinksmith in Sachsenhausen because there will you have both styles available in one place: they have a couple IPAs on tap and they have GetrÃ¤nkeschmied Schmidt Helles on tap.
Brew dog in Bahnhofsviertel on kaiserstraÃŸe carries quite a few. Over 35 on draft on Rotation.
but avoid the food in Fox and Hound ðŸ˜‚
I cannot recommend this. The service is the worst one i have ever seen.
